Questionnairehttps://voicecollab.ai/fhir/Questionnaire/dneuroparkinsonsdiseaseschema#1.5.1
diagnosis_parkinsons_gsd_category_1Category 1 - Parkinsonism0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_gsd_category_1_calculationCategory 1 Criteria Met0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_gsd_category_2Category 2 - Exclusion criteria0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_gsd_category_2_calculationCategory 2 Criteria Met0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_gsd_category_3Category 3 - Supportive criteria0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_gsd_category_3_calculationCategory 3 Criteria Met0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_gsd_calculationDoes the patient meet the diagnostic criteria for Parkinson's Disease (Parkinsonism) based on the criteria above?0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_disease_subtypeSpecify the subtype of Parkinson's Disease in the patient:0..1choiceOptions: 7 options
diagnosis_parkinsons_disease_subtype_otherIf you selected "Other Parkinsonism or Atypical Parkinsonism", please specify:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_etiologyWhat is the suspected or known etiology of Parkinson's disease in the patient?0..1choiceOptions: 3 options
diagnosis_parkinsons_etiology_fpdIf you selected "Familial Parkinson's Disease", please specify the genetic mutation if known:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_etiology_efIf you selected "Environmental Factors", please specify if known:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_dsWhat is the current stage/severity of Parkinson's disease in the patient? â€¢ Hoehn and Yahr Scale:0..1choiceOptions: 5 options
diagnosis_parkinsons_maPlease provide scores or results from validated cognitive assessment tools:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_ma_uprdsUnified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS)0..1choiceOptions: 4 options
diagnosis_parkinsons_ma_updrs_part_i_scorePart I (Intellectual function, mood, behavior) score:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_ma_updrs_part_ii_scorePart II (Activities of daily living) score:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_ma_updrs_part_iii_scorePart III (Motor Examination) score:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_ma_updrs_part_iv_scorePart IV (Motor complications) score:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_ma_otherIf you selected "Other motor assessment tool", please specify:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_non_motor_symptomsAre there significant non-motor symptoms associated with Parkinson's disease in the patient?0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
diagnosis_parkinsons_non_motor_symptoms_yesIf you selected "Yes", please specify:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_treatment_obtainedHas the patient undergone any treatment for Parkinson's disease?0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
diagnosis_parkinsons_treatment_obtained_yesYes0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_treatment_obtained_yes_medicationsMedications:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_treatment_obtained_yes_medications_otherIf you selected "Other", please specify:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_treatment_obtained_yes_npiNon-pharmacological interventions:0..1string
diagnosis_parkinsons_treatment_obtained_yes_npi_otherIf you selected "Other", please specify:0..1string

Documentation for this format

Option Sets

Answer options for diagnosis_parkinsons_disease_subtype

  • Idiopathic Parkinson's Disease (IPD)
  • Multiple System Atrophy (MSA)
  • Progressive Supranuclear Palsy (PSP)
  • Corticobasal Degeneration (CBD)
  • Dementia with Lewy Bodies (DLB)
  • Other Parkinsonism or Atypical Parkinsonism
  • Not Sure / Undetermined

Answer options for diagnosis_parkinsons_etiology

  • Idiopathic (unknown cause)
  • Familial Parkinson's Disease
  • Environmental factors

Answer options for diagnosis_parkinsons_ds

  • Stage 1 (Unilateral involvement only)
  • Stage 2 (Bilateral involvement without impairment of balance)
  • Stage 3 (Bilateral involvement with mild to moderate impairment of balance)
  • Stage 4 (Severe disability but still able to walk or stand unassisted)
  • Stage 5 (Wheelchair-bound or bedridden unless aided)

Answer options for diagnosis_parkinsons_ma_uprds

  • Part I (Intellectual function
  • Part II (Activities of daily living) score
  • Part III (Motor Examination) score
  • Part IV (Motor complications) score

Answer options for diagnosis_parkinsons_non_motor_symptoms

  • Yes
  • No

Answer options for diagnosis_parkinsons_treatment_obtained

  • Yes
  • No

item.text: Does the patient meet the diagnostic criteria for Parkinson's Disease (Parkinsonism) based on the criteria above?
Specify the subtype of Parkinson's Disease in the patient:
If you selected "Other Parkinsonism or Atypical Parkinsonism", please specify:
What is the suspected or known etiology of Parkinson's disease in the patient?
If you selected "Familial Parkinson's Disease", please specify the genetic mutation if known:
If you selected "Environmental Factors", please specify if known:

What is the current stage/severity of Parkinson's disease in the patient?
â€¢	Hoehn and Yahr Scale:

answerOption.valueString: Stage 2 (Bilateral involvement without impairment of balance)
Stage 3 (Bilateral involvement with mild to moderate impairment of balance)
Stage 4 (Severe disability but still able to walk or stand unassisted)

item.text: Please provide scores or results from validated cognitive assessment tools:

answerOption.valueString: Part II (Activities of daily living) score

item.text: Part I (Intellectual function, mood, behavior) score:
Part II (Activities of daily living) score:
If you selected "Other motor assessment tool", please specify:
Are there significant non-motor symptoms associated with Parkinson's disease in the patient?
Has the patient undergone any treatment for Parkinson's disease?
